feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAC Key User rights with other View reporting rights
entry.content:
Hi,

We have enabled Key User rights in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for selected users, allowing them to create their own stories within designated folders (e.g., Folder A and Folder B in our example).

Our SAC environment primarily uses live data models, which means roles based on import models are not applicable.

In our current setup:

  • The user has view access to Report A (based on Model A).
  • The same user has Key User rights for Report B (based on Model B), enabling them to create additional stories based on Model B within Folder B.

However, since the user also has Key User rights and view access to Model A, we’ve observed that they are able to create stories based on Model A within Folder B—which is not intended.

We would like to know if there is a way to restrict story creation in Folder B to only those based on Model B, even though the user has access to other models.

Thank you!

entry.title: Widget is visible in ppt export even when made invisible
entry.content:
Hello SAC experts,

I would like to export a SAC story into PPT in a certain layout, which includes only widget required for the export. This means I would like to remove certain widgets before exporting to PPT.

I have created a button, which makes unwanted widgets invisible:  xxx.setVisible(false). When I export the story in PPT format, it exports all widgets independent on value of this parameter (all widgets are visible). The same behavior is when using the standard PPF export or "Export To PPTX". Unfortunately "Export To PPTX" does not offer the option to chose the widgets as in ExportToPDF. Can you please advice, how to adapt a story into a print version without creating a separate story with the print specific layout?

Thank you.

entry.title: NDC Converter 2.0: Automating Your Journey from BusinessObjects to Cloud Analytics
entry.content:
SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) provides a unified platform for data ingestion, semantic modeling, governance and analytics. For teams migrating from SAP BusinessObjects (BO), BDC enables:

  • A governed semantic layer in SAP Datasphere that faithfully reproduces and extends your existing BO universes with standardized naming conventions, hierarchies and calculated measures.
  • Cloud-native analytics in SAC for reporting, planning and predictive scenarios, powered by either live data connections or scheduled replication jobs.
  • A clear modernization path for SAP BW/4HANA artifacts and non-SAP sources, preserving embedded business logic while consolidating disparate models.

By porting Web Intelligence (WebI) content into BDC, you can retire legacy BO infrastructure and establish a sustainable foundation built on remote or replicated tables, graphical and SQL views and published semantic models that are fully consumable in SAC.

 

In this follow-up to our NDC Converter introduction, we’ll showcase its newest capabilities and zoom in on how REST APIs, RPA and the SAP BDC stack work together to fully automate your migration workflow and eliminate uncertainty that is often associated with these sorts of projects.

Analysis & clean-up

Migration kicks off with a thorough source analysis powered by our enhanced scanning engine. After installing a lightweight Windows executable in your environment, NDC Converter uses the BusinessObjects REST API to perform a repository-wide scan - cataloging WebI documents, variables, filters and data sources. Parallel processing enables multiple report structures to be inventoried simultaneously, cutting traditional analysis times from days to hours.

If BO access is restricted, you can export a full content catalog instead and NDC Converter will generate a self-service metadata report for rapid sizing and compliance checks. These automated scans deliver hard metrics on:

  • Volume: total reports, pages, charts and objects
  • Complexity: calculations, variables, dimensions and interactive features
  • Usage: inactive or overlapping content

Armed with this detailed data, we can scope migration efforts accurately within days rather than weeks, giving prospects immediate insight into their BI landscape without manual, time-consuming analysis.

Automated report migration

Once WebI queries are identified, the next step is to align them with target system (usually SAP Datasphere but other options available too – for reference see previous blog post). Steps here include:

  • Linking each WebI query to its target system
  • Generating the necessary migration definitions
  • Automatically provisioning and deploying the corresponding tables

If you’re working with many tables, the “mass deploy” feature lets you push them live in bulk—no tedious one-by-one clicks.

After tables are deployed, we configure on-demand or scheduled data replication to maintain synchronization between target and source systems, followed by creating graphical and SQL-based views to implement calculation logic. The final step is to publish these views to SAP Analytics Cloud where up-to-date data can be accessed.

The data source layer migration involves analyzing the BO repository, migrating universe metadata and/or transitioning live models based on BEx queries. Upon completion of the initial data migration, a comprehensive semantic model is introduced that mirrors your original WebI structures including dimensions, measures, hierarchies and data. This transformation provides a cloud-ready foundation for all SAP Analytics Cloud initiatives.

NDC Converter 2.0

With your semantic model live, we proceed with WebI reports migration into SAP Analytics Cloud as interactive stories with new high functional coverage. NDC Converter retrieves each report’s layout, structures, tables, charts, filters and visual elements via the BusinessObjects REST API. A blueprint compatible with RPA processing is produced, covering:

  • Layout & structure: multi‑page documents, IDs, descriptions, pages/tabs.
  • Tables & crosstabs: calculated and restricted measures, variables and common WebI calculations.
  • Charts: Bar/Column, Line, Numeric Point, Pie, Donut, Heat Map, Tree Map, Bubble, Scatterplot.
  • Formatting & UX: predefined template stories, titles, text, headers/footers, icons.
  • Filters & interactivity: input controls, query filters, single object filters, drill, hyperlinks.

The RPA bot, delivered as a Chrome extension, reads this blueprint and automates the reconstruction of each report in SAC Story 2.0, preserving original tables, crosstabs, charts, parameters and filters. The resulting SAC Stories mirror your WebI reports while leveraging cloud-native data models.

What stays manual (and why)

NDC Converter automates routine migration tasks, allowing your team to focus on strategic design and governance – here are cases where automation does not bring added value:

  • Data model (business semantics) design: turning technical structures into robust semantic layer requires continuous alignment on reporting vision.
  • Edge cases & redesign: in situations where 1:1 replication isn’t optimal, we propose a workaround solution to comply with business and technical needs.
  • Environment setup: Migrating users, roles and platform configurations using a mix of guided best practices and selective automation.

Collaborate end-end delivery

NDC Converter is an ideal tool for complex migration scenarios, automating the transfer of every structural element—from metadata and queries to filters and visual object definitions. Once the converter has recreated the report skeletons in SAC, your BI team can take over the final steps: refining layouts, adjusting chart properties and validating calculation logic. This collaborative workflow ensures that the most time-consuming technical migrations are handled automatically, while you retain full control over presentation, branding and business requirements.

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud - Lock Data Entry for Read-User
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

The standard behavior of Data Access Control is that read-only users are still able to enter data, but they are not able to publish it.

This can be confusing. Is there a way to completely lock the data for users who only have read access, while still allowing users with write access to enter data in the same table?

Kind regards,

Ismail

entry.title: How to show Current vs Previous Month-Year values with two independent filters in SAC?
entry.content:
I have a requirement in SAP Analytics Cloud where a table needs to show Current Month and Previous Month values side by side.

Currently, I use a single month_year filter. For example, if the user selects June 2025, the table displays:

  • Current Month = June 2025

  • Previous Month = May 2025

However, the client wants two separate filters:

  • One filter for Current Month-Year (e.g., June 2025)

  • Another filter for Previous Month-Year (e.g., May 2024)

This way, the user can choose any two periods independently (even across different years), and the table should display:

  • Current Value: June 2025

  • Previous Value: May 2024

  • Difference: June 2025 – May 2024

Data Source: SAP ECC 

Is it possible to design such functionality in SAC stories (e.g., via input controls, variables, or restricted measures)? If yes, what would be the best approach?

entry.title: moving/rolling sum for specific amount of dates in SAC
entry.content:
Hello community,

I have a requirement to calculate a rolling sum over 7 days in this case. And I want to visualize this value over time in a chart.

Here is an example of how the calculation should look like:

Datesales7 day sum
01.09.2025125125
02.09.2025100225
03.09.202575300
04.09.2025250550
05.09.2025100650
06.09.20253501000
07.09.20252751275
08.09.20251501300
09.09.20251001300
10.09.20251101335

The calculation function for running total does not really work here, because of the missing option to restrict the time period to 7 days. I have also tried this formula: ResultLookup([sales] ;[date]= PREVIOUS(90; "DAY";[date]))  but unfortunately the system does not allow the function PREVIOUS to be used in this context. 

I am using an analytical model from SAP Datasphere as source.

Does anybody know a solution to this problem?

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud - Lock Year Column in SAC Excel AddIn
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We would like to lock the Year column so that data entry is only possible for Months. We solved this by using styling rules.

Unfortunately, styling rules cannot be used in the SAC Excel Add-In. Does anyone have an idea on how to achieve this requirement?

Kind regards,
Ismail

entry.title: SAC Story Filters: Profit Center & Product – Dependent Access Query
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have two public dimensions Profit Center and Product added both as a story filter and enabled Data Access Control for the Profit Center dimension, giving access based on their Business Area say (A, B, C, D, E) and user access is set so they only see profit centers linked to their Business Area.

Current behavior:
Users see only the profit centers they’re permitted to access. However, our goal is for users to select a profit center and then have the Product filter dynamically show only the products associated with that profit center rather than displaying all products.

for example, suppose a user in Business Area 'B' sees only “Ducati” as their profit center. When they choose Ducati, the Product filter should then only offer options like “Panigale V4” and “Monster,” which are explicitly linked to Ducati, instead of showing products linked to other profit centers.

So, to achieve should we enable Data Access Control for the Product dimension as well, so users see only products related to their assigned profit centers? Or is there a more efficient way to implement linked filters using standard SAC functionality, without relying on JavaScript?

Thanks.

entry.title: Apache Tomcat upgrade for SAP Analytics Cloud (9.0.44 to one the latest Apache Tomcat 9.0.x version)
entry.content:
Hello everyone

we are using SAP Analytics Cloud installed starting from SAC Kit Agent cloudagent 1.0.339 version.

It installed, as part of this software package, also Apache Tomcat version 9.0.44 and JVM 8 on the server.

Now, we received a security vulnerability threat report and the security team has suggested to upgrade at least to 9.0.98 Tomcat version on the server.

So we would like to install this Tomcat version (that is a minor Tomcat upgrade because it's inside the 9.0.x family), and we have seen using a compatibility matrix, that JVM 8 remains compatible, and so we would like to upgrade to 9.0.108 version.

My question is: when upgrading to 9.0.108 Tomcat version , will the installed version of SAC remain fully compatible with this new version of Tomcat?

If not, please kindly suggest how to proceed how to achieve compatibility between SAC and Tomcat

Thank you so much, any comment will be appreciate

entry.title: SAC optimised story using a live connection - no data to fetch using restricted calculated measures
entry.content:
Just wondering if anyone else has seen this behaviour,

As an example I create a restricted measure e.g.
Sales Revenue restricted by Dimension Country = UK

so really simple,  but it always returns no data to fetch.

Yet if I simply add the Sales Revenue to say a numeric point chart, then add the Country Dimension as a filter = UK   the measure shows data as expected.

really weird....

entry.title: how to start learning SAP - trainings, courses
entry.content:
Hi everybody, 

I’m new here and I have a question. I want to learn SAP and am new to this technology. Yes, I know it’s pretty tough with a lot to learn. But I want to do it because I want to change my profile. My background is data warehouse development, data modeling, and ETL development. Here I want to pivot instead of diving deeper into AWS or Azure cloud; I want to learn SAP, maybe SAP BTP and Cloud.

What do you think? Are these good topics for the future and with my background? Is there anyone here who can offer advice on which courses and trainings to start with for an introduction?

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for Direct Tax Calculation & Reporting
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm currently exploring the capabilities of SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and its potential application in the realm of direct tax calculation and reporting for a potential customer here in Italy.

I'm particularly interested in understanding:

- Existing Templates/Accelerators: Have any members successfully implemented SAC for direct tax, and are there any available accelerators, templates, content packages, or success stories you can share?

I understand how complex and volatile the tax regulatory landscape is, but any support, insights, experiences, documentation, or links to relevant SAP blogs/articles would be highly appreciated.

 

Thank you in advance for your time and expertise!

Best regards,
Andrea

entry.title: How to create 2 input control filters dependent on each other in story
entry.content:
Kindly help me on below requirement please;

suppose I have 2 Dimensions as shared in below screenshots:

Profitcenter (attribute is Group)

Projectcode ((attribute is Group)

Requirement is I need to apply 2 input control filters on each dim above in my input form in story but Profit center values should be dependent on project code selection ..e.g.. if we select projectcode= PP_SRW then the respective profit center should be seen/ selected only…i.e.. PB_SRW, 0569A00000,0569B00000 (but NOT 0123A00000 as its under PP_XXX attribute of profitcenter which is diff from PB_SRW) and accordingly my table data should be filtered.

entry.title: SAC Application script, chart onselect value passing into url parameter
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying to capture the selected dimension value from a chart. This value i am trying to pass into URL parameter to child report. 
Value is getting passed to child report but data is not getting filtered. 

I have created script variable "RegionFilter" both in parent report and child report. 

When i am passign the parameter value from a Dropdown or Check box, data is getting filter in child report, but with chart it is not working. 
Parent report parameter passing url :- 

NavigationUtils.openStory("9E218282F57BE2D4EBBC6959FE0D0AB1", "a31b3cd2-f023-4b22-ac46-3e90b81c8e7a",
[UrlParameter.create("p_RegionFilter",CB_Country.getSelectedKeys().join("|")),UrlParameter.create("p_MaterialFilter",List_Material.getSelectedKeys().join("|"))]);

Child report logic to apply filter :-

RegionFilter;
console.log(RegionFilter);
 
if (RegionFilter==="ALL") {
console.log(RegionFilter);
Table_1.getDataSource().removeDimensionFilter("Country");
}
else if (RegionFilter!=="ALL") {
console.log("Chart selected value ... "+ RegionFilter);
Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("Country",RegionFilter.split("|"));
}
 
Can anyone of you please help me in this.
Thanks,
Subash

entry.content:
Dear all,

I have a requirement to  show the selected dimension from data point selection on a chart such as below. I can only read if the dimension is properly filtered but no luck finding at data point selection.  Has anyone a solution? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Guidance Needed: Creating KPI Report with Graphs and KPI Cards in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP Exports,

I am creating a KPI report based on CDS views and analytical reports. I have tried three options — Generic Drilldown, Analytical List Page, and Data Analyzer and I also created stories. However, the report is not displaying correctly across the three display types and would like to know which option is best for visualizing the entire report in graphical form and for presenting data in KPI cards.

Could you please provide step-by-step instructions for creating a KPI report with graphical visualizations and KPI cards? 

Thank you and kind regards,

entry.title: SAC Application script : Pop up button onclick code not working
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying with code like, when we click on cancel button what ever the bookmark which has been added to Dropdown box should get deleted.

When we click on save button what ever the bookmark name given in input field, is get added to dropdown box. 
I am looking for functionality like, when we click on cancel button what ever the bookmark name added to dropdown box should get delete. 
I am trying with below code for this ..

if (ListBox_1.getSelectedKey()==="Personal") {
console.log(ListBox_1.getSelectedKey());
console.log("SV_BKM_P value is "+SV_BMK_Personal);
var bmk = SV_BMK_Personal;
var bookmark = "P_"+SV_BMK_Personal;
console.log(bookmark);
console.log("Clicked on Cancel");
if (buttonId === "Cancel") {
Bookmarks.deleteBookmark(bookmark);
if (SV_Personal_ID.includes(bmk)) {
var number = SV_Personal_ID.indexOf(SV_BMK_Personal);
var id = SV_Personal_ID.substring(0,number-2);
DD_Personal.removeItem(id);
console.log(id);
}
POP_Up.close();
}  
else if (buttonId ==="OK") {
console.log("Clicked on OK");
POP_Up.close();
} }
 
else if (ListBox_1.getSelectedKey()==="Global") {
if (buttonId==="Cancel") {
var bmk1 = SV_BMK_Global;
var bookmakr1 = "G_"+bmk1;
Bookmarks.deleteBookmark(bookmakr1);
POP_Up.close();
}
else if (buttonId==="OK") {
POP_Up.close();
}
}
 
But my code is not working as expected like, when i am clicking on cancel button bookmark it not getting deleted from dropdown box.
Can anyone of you please help me on this.

Thanks

entry.title: Handling YTD and Previous Month Selection in SAC
entry.content:
In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), I have a report based on SAP ECC / S/4 HANA with a Month_Year filter. Currently, selecting a month (e.g., June 2025) shows:

  • Current Value:  June 2025 

  • Previous Value: May 2025

The client now wants two separate filters:

  1. Current Month-Year (e.g., June 2025) → display YTD from Jan to selected month

  2. Previous Month-Year (e.g., May 2024) → display only the selected previous month

    I have created calculation input control but it doesn't provides YTD .

How can we implement this in SAC so that both filters work independently and show the expected values?

entry.title: Exporting Plan Data from SAC to SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We want to export planning data from our SAC Model to S/4HANA and more specific, to ACDOCP. As we can see, there is only one export method available: Clean and Replace.

However, we do not wish to delete the existing records of ACDOCP. 

Is there any way, that we can export our data to ACDOCP without deleting any of the other records?

Thank you in advance for you help!

SAP Analytics Cloud
